ab.title: Numbers 12
ab.l: And Miriam and Aaron spoke about Moses, about the matter ofthe Cushite woman whom he had taken — because he had taken an Cushite woman.
And they said, ‘Has the Lord only just spoken by Moses?Lo, he has spoken also by us.’ And the Lord heard it.
And Moses, the prophet, was much more humble than all the menwho were on the face of the earth.
Andthe Lord spoke suddenly to Moses and to Aaron and to Miriam, ‘Come out,even the three of you, to the tent of meeting.’ And the three of them came out.
And the divine Presence of the Lord came down in the pillar of the cloudand stood in the door of the tent and called Aaronand Miriam, and they both went out.
Andhe said, ‘Hear now my words: If there is a prophet among you,I, the Lord, will be known to him in a vision, I will speak with him through a dream.
Not so is my servant Moses; in all my househe is faithful.
Mind to mind I will speak with him andthrough vision and not through riddles, and he sees the divine Presence of the Lord.And why did you not fear to speak about my servant Moses?’
And the anger of the Lord was kindled against them, andhis divine Presence went.
And the cloud departedfrom over the tent. And, lo, Miriam became leprous, like snow. AndAaron turned to Miriam, and, lo, she was leprous.
And Aaron saidto Moses, ‘I pray you, my lord, do not set the punishmentof a sin on us which we did foolishly, and which we sinned.
I pray you, let her not be like the dead who, when he comes out ofhis mother’s womb, half of his flesh is eaten up.’
AndMoses prayed to the Lord, saying, ‘I pray you, oh God,heal her though, now.’
And the Lord saidto Moses, ‘And if her father had but spitin her face, should she not be ashamed seven days? She shall be shut upoutside the camp seven days, and after that let her be gathered back.’
And Miriam was shut up outside the camp sevendays. And the people did not travel until Miriam was gathered back.
And afterward the people set out from Hazeroth,and they camped in the wilderness of Paran.
